title: Newsletter 139:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The secret to longevity includes genetics, diet and most importantly, HUMOR! Present-day McGill thaws out after the big New Years Eve freeze. Plans for the upcoming year look positive!
subject: Holidays

title: Newsletter 140:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith recalls thedoldums during the month of January and how McGill kids of the 1940s made the time pass. Modern-day McGill experiences some cold days, but also 50 degree weather! A clothing store readies for opening day in the old bank.
subject: Schools

title: Newsletter 141:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith's talks about the history of the McGill Club (formerly the American Trading Co. circa 1906-1908.) Post-fire repair work begins on the McGill Club. Historic images of the 1911 brick-lined converter are included
subject: Converters;Businesses

title: Newsletter 142:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: How kids survived McGill in the 30s, 40s and 50s without TV, internet, iPhones, etc.
subject: Toys

title: Newsletter 143:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Memories of winter scouting trips in 1948. Scouts used government surplus gear to warm and shelter themselves. Modern-day McGill gets some VIP visitors.
subject: Scouting;Drug Stores

title: Newsletter 144:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The invention of the TV in the late 1950s caused McGill residents to lessen their time socializing and playing sports. McGill was a powerhouse in baseball from the late 20s to the 50s.
subject: Sports;Baseball

title: Newsletter 145:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: An abundance of snow in the 1940s and 1950s let to fun activities during school recess. Lack of TV or modern-day computer-games led children to use their time outdoors more productively. The present-day McGill drug store gets some new lighting.
subject: People

title: Newsletter 146:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Flags and patriotism in McGill. The history of the McGill flagpoles. The present-day McGill Town Council has approved refurbishment of the flagpole on the "circle"; complete with a solar light to shine at night.
subject: Patriotism

title: Newsletter 147:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The history of several buildings on Main Street is explored. The location of the Greek flag that was raised on June 30, 1918 is questioned.
subject: Main Street

title: Newsletter 148:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: An engineering drawing from 1922 and various photos (over years) seem to indicate two buildings merging together to become the McGill Laundry. The present-day McGill Drug Store receives a large donation!
subject: Main Street;Drug Stores

title: Newsletter 149:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith recalls how he and his 6-7th grade classmates were taught wood-working skills. Something that has fallen by the wayside in today's classrooms. A wonderful photo of the grade-school woodshop building is included. An idea to turn the old hospital into a present-day museum is presented to the McGill Town Council.
subject: Schools

title: Newsletter 150:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: McGill Grade School teachers had their own dormitory. A picture is included in this issue. Single women were housed in the dormitory and many went on to mary McGill men. The building still stands, but is in desperate need of repair.
subject: Schools;Kennecott

title: Newsletter 151:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Several images of the Kennecott smoke stacks are included - one showing all three stacks. Rumor has it that Delta airlines used the stacks as a landmark.
subject: Smoke Stacks;Kennecott

title: Newsletter 152:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith prepares to go to the city council with plans for the McGill Heritage Center. The old hospital is the proposed site of the Heritage Center. The Drug Store gets a cleaning!
subject: Heritage Center;Hospitals;Drug Stores

title: Newsletter 153:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith recalls some of the old shops and their brands.
subject: Main Street

title: Newsletter 154:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: An image from 1909 showing early housing is included. The present-day McGill City Council apporves the motion to create the Heritage Center. It has been passed to the White Pine Countyl Commission.
subject: Heritage Center

title: Newsletter 155:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A wonderful anecdote featuring Frank Burnside, the first man to take off and land an airplane in White Pine County, circa July 4th, 1913. Frank made a total of four flights that memorable day. New scanners arrive at the drugstore!
subject: People

title: Newsletter 156:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A vintage photo of the drug store from 1941, showing the Pharmacist and Druggist. Keith begins to scan the thousands of vintage document begins at the drugstore.
subject: People;Drug Stores;Heritage Center

title: Newsletter 157:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Friday the 13th inspires a memorable anecdote about superstition. Keith reaches a milestone as he scans over 2100 pages of inventory at the drugstore.
subject: People;Drug Stores;Heritage Center

title: Newsletter 158:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: 1930s and 40s McGill kids got along just fine with toys that didn't require batteries or electricity! Ingenuity inspired kids to build things with their own two hands.
subject: Toys;Drug Stores

title: Newsletter 159:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: More toys! Toys were simple during the pre and post-war years, but challenged kids' abilities to create. Wheelbarrow's became transportation devices, chemistry sets produced lead lead soldiers and spare parts became model airplanes. Keith gets formal approval to use the old McGill hospital as the McGill Heritage Center. Stay tuned.
subject: Toys

title: Newsletter 160:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: When plans go astray. Fun anecdote on fishing, bridges and life. Present-day McGill moves along with Heritage Center planning and a potential idea to operate the soda fountain at the drugstore. The music festival is this week.
subject: People

title: Newsletter 161:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Memories of 1945 McGill, when birds were plentiful and motorized vehicles were not.
subject: Birds

title: Newsletter 162:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Present-day McGill residents notice the lack of birds, bees and butterflies. Quite a contrast to the old days when birds were plentiful.
subject: Birds

title: Newsletter 163:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The construction of the pipeline to bring water from dams built in Duck Creek valley was brought to fruition on December 25, 1907. On this date, the first water flowed through the pipeline. In 1929, the wooden pipeline was replaced by a steel one. Present-day McGill gets a new council member and McGill strives to become a destination instead of a pass-through town.
subject: Smelters;Dams

title: Newsletter 164:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: When the trains came through McGill to pick up ore, they were sprayed with a salt solution to prevent the wet ore from freezing and sticking to the sides of the cars in winter months. It was a huge advantage over heating the sides of the cars with a flamethrower! Included is an image of the spraying device.
subject: Railroads

title: Newsletter 165:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: This month marks the 100 year anniversary of the tragic McGill fire of 1922. Included in this issue are images of the fire and the sad aftermath. There is also an image of the newly rebuilt mill, which took only 68 days to build.
subject: Tragedies

title: Newsletter 166:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: An explanation of the two reverb furnaces and their purpose within the smelter. Present-day McGill experiences a hot and windy July.
subject: Smelters

title: Newsletter 167:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Recycling turned old junk into useful items for McGill youth, circa the late 1940s. The Red Cross provided swimming lessons for McGill kids in the community "pool", which was a popular pastime.
subject: Pools

title: Newsletter 168:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Memories of Engine #40, that used to bring freight into McGill from Cobre. #40 is still around and is housed at the Nevada Northern Depot. Present-day McGill was granted $5000.00 for maintenance projects.
subject: Railroads

title: Newsletter 169:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Scrap metal for the war effort became the fate of several old engines. Present-day McGill sees an influx visitors from Las Vegas.
subject: Railroads;WWII

title: Newsletter 170:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The 2022 quilt show, held annually, comes to White Pine. The drugstore gets a coat of fresh paint.
subject: Quilts

title: Newsletter 171:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The McGill Theater gets a facelift and the Drugstore paint job is in-progress.
subject: Scouts;Main Street

title: Newsletter 172:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A vintage image of Main Street (approx. late 1950s or early 1960s) is shown. The Clubhouse and Steptoe Service Station can be seen. Scanning Drugstore inventory continues as 2650 pages are now complete.
subject: Main Street

title: Newsletter 173:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Inflation and the price of gas over the decades. Present-day McGill readies for the Annual Splash event.
subject: Service Stations

title: Newsletter 174:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Snow days never happened in McGill. Kids found plenty of ways to entertain themselves during cold winter months. The annual McGill Birthday bash was a huge success.
subject: Schools

title: Newsletter 175:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith recalls shoes in the early years of McGill, when kids had less of a selection! Work continues at the Drugstore.
subject: Schools;Drug Stores

title: Newsletter 176:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The process of pouring copper bars (in the 1950s) is explained. The Drugstore renovation continues. A vintage image of the Liberty Pit is included.
subject: Kennecott;Smelters;Drug Stores

title: Newsletter 177:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The Drugstore gets some special visitors
subject: People

title: Newsletter 178:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Boulder/Hoover Dam construction occurred in the 1930s as a project to put people to work during the Great Depression. Keith's father worked on the dam construction.
subject: Dams;Kennecott

title: Newsletter 179:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A brief history on how Hoover Dam was constructed as well as the 112 workers who were killed during the construction. the Drugstore gets some visitors from Germany!
subject: Dams

title: Newsletter 180:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The kindness of strangers and the return of a Prince to the Drugstore.
subject: Drug Stores

title: Newsletter 181:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Memories of Halloween, pumpkin-carving and scary stories in the 1940s and 1950s.
subject: Holidays

title: Newsletter 182:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: An update on the many changes (both cosmetic and functional) at the Drugstore. Things are looking good! A vintage image of the McGill Candy Kitchen and Bernstein Clothiers (now the antique store) is included.
subject: Drug Stores;Main Street

title: Newsletter 183:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Marching Band from surrounding schools are displayed at the Drugstore. Keith recalls days gone by when kids proudly marched at the various parades to represent their city and school.
subject: Schools;Bands

title: Newsletter 184:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: More on the marching bands that existed in the 1950s and the effort that went into preparing for each performance.
subject: Schools;Bands

title: Newsletter 185:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Thanksgiving in 1940s McGill was a time for family, food and fun. It still is today, just more expensive and commercialized.
subject: Holidays

title: Newsletter 186:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: As the 1960 Christmas holiday approaches, McGill readies itself for the arrival of Santa! This tradition still exists today in McGill.
subject: Holidays

title: Newsletter 187:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Memories of Christmases past and the wonderful food that always accompanies the holiday.
subject: Holidays

title: Newsletter 188:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: McGill celebrates the holiday in the midst of WWII.
subject: Holidays;WWII

title: Newsletter 189:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A colorful Christmas image from the Idaho Meridian Times, circa 1932.
subject: Holidays

title: Newsletter 190:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: More wonderful Christmas and New Years memories as well an an anecdote about the way McGill celebrated New Years back in the day!
subject: Holidays

title: The staff at the McGill Pharmacy, circa 1941,
creator: Keith Gibson
description: L-R: Walter Zeigenbein, Mary Evelyn Oxborrow, Charles Handley. Walter (Pharmacist) and Mary later married. Charles (Druggist). Several items in the image are still in the drug store today.
subject: Drug Stores

title: Teachers Dormitory
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The McGill Grad School teacher's dormitory, courtesy of Margaret Papez Payton
subject: Schools

title: Lage's Stage Shop
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Lage's (Stage Stop) in the late 1940's or early 1950's.
subject: Railroads

title: Vanner Tables
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Vanner Tables were used to separate or concentrate the copper and other metals from the crushed ore.
subject: Kennecott

title: McGill Drugstore
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Unknown employee at the Drugstore.
subject: Drug Stores

title: Drugstore employee
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Connie Roberts worked at the Drugstore in the 1950s.
subject: People
